meanings.definition: Something given in return for good behavior or effort.
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave a reward to the student for completing all their homework.
meanings.sent2: The puppy received a reward for learning a new trick.
meanings.sent3: The cat expected a reward for catching the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The smile on her face was the best reward for his hard work.
meanings.sent5: The shiny gold star served as a tangible reward for her achievements.

meanings.definition: To give something in return for good behavior or effort.
meanings.sent1: Parents often reward their children with treats for good behavior.
meanings.sent2: The coach will reward the team with a pizza party for winning the championship.
meanings.sent3: The magician will reward the audience with a surprise trick at the end of the show.
meanings.sent4: Nature rewards those who take care of the environment with beautiful landscapes.
meanings.sent5: Hard work and dedication will always reward you with success in the end.
